title: Doctor sends 9,000 angry messages after being dumped by Tinder date
text:

A doctor who was dumped by her former Tinder date allegedly sent more than 9,000 messages as part of a harassment campaign, a court has heard.

Scorned Denise Jane Lee sent texts and emails to Matthew Holberton, his new girlfriend and their family members after becoming obsessed with him following a brief relationship in Sydney.

The pair reportedly had four dinner dates in 2015 and two sexual encounters before he broke off the relationship and moved to Melbourne.

Mr Holberton then began dating Georgia Dempster, but Lee allegedly sent "vile" messages to the pair, as well as Mrs Dempster's mother Robin, and their colleagues.

(Image: AAP/PA Images)

Among them were "whatever you value most, I'll target", "I will make you pay", and "you deserve everything you're going to get", according to 9News.

After being arrested in February 2017, Lee was found to have social media pictures of Mr Holberton, along with tracking data from his cycle routes and information on his friends.

The 40-year-old radiologist pleaded guilty to three counts of using a carriage service to harass or menace or offend, and one count of intimidation, according to local media reports.

She was initially due to face a five-day hearing but pleaded guilty to four of 10 charges following negotiations between her lawyer and the prosecution.

The parties will now prepare an agreed statement of the facts.

Magistrate Michael Barko refused to dismiss the charges on mental health grounds and adjourned the case for a directions hearing on Tuesday.
description: Denise Jane Lee and Matthew Holberton are believed to have had a brief relationship involving two sexual encounters before the Mr Holberton broke it off
